did.abstract: Records, 1940-1945, of the Engineering Science and Management War Training Program at the University of Michigan during World War II. Includes diaries, August 1941-August 1945, of Robert H. Sherlock, coordinator of the program.

bioghist.p: Set up in 1941 by Robert B. Sherlock, the program trained more than 12,500 men and women for immediate service to industry and local governments during its five-year existence. Courses included aircraft inspection, aerial bombardment protection of cities, ordinance materials inspection, industrial water supply and treatment, all taught by faculty members

scopecontent.p: Records include the programs for each year, a trainee file, and the diaries of Sherlock during the time he served as coordinator, 1941-1945.
